title: Harry and Meghan Help Refugees in the Middle East
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan, also known as the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, have traveled to Jordan in the Middle East. This is their first trip together to another country in 18 months. They are there to learn about and help people who have been forced to leave their homes because of wars and conflicts. They were invited by Dr. Tedros from the World Health Organization (WHO). In Jordan, they met with leaders and visited places that provide health care, food, and support for children. Harry and Meghan's foundation, called Archewell, has given money to help children from places like Gaza and Ukraine get medical care and artificial limbs. Their visit shows they care about helping vulnerable communities.

Who invited Harry and Meghan to Jordan?
What does the Archewell Foundation do?
Which place is mentioned as needing help?
What did Harry and Meghan visit in Jordan?

background_read: Harry and Meghan are a famous couple who used to be part of the British royal family but now live in the United States. They often work to help people in need through their charity. Refugees are people who have to leave their homes because of wars or other dangers, and they often need food, shelter, and medical care. Jordan is a country in the Middle East that helps many refugees from nearby conflicts. The World Health Organization is a global group that works to improve health for everyone.
Article_Structure: WHO: Prince Harry and Meghan, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex
WHAT: They visited Jordan to support refugees and vulnerable communities
WHERE: In Jordan, specifically Amman, the capital city
WHY: To highlight efforts to help people affected by conflict and displacement

perspectives.description: Harry and Meghan are focusing on helping people in need, showing compassion and support for refugees.
